references.text: Waypoints Vol 05: PPL/CPL Air Law. Chapter 2: The Aircraft

questions.question: Which certificate is issued when an aircraft is entered onto the New Zealand Register of Aircraft?
How long can you hire or lease an aircraft registered by someone else before you're required to re-register it under your name?
How does CAR Part 1 define the Owner of an aircraft?
questions.answer: Any person lawfully entitled to the posittion of the aircraft for 28 days or longer.

questions.question: Whose name is the certificate of registration issued under?

references.text: CAR Part 47 (47.55 - Registration and grant of certificate)

questions.question: Can an aircraft be flown if its certificate of registration has expired? If yes, for how long?
questions.answer: Yes. For 28 days from the date of expiry of the certificate.

references.text: CAR Part 47 (47.59 - Operation of aircraft after expiry of certificate)

questions.question: When does the certificate of registration expire?
questions.answer: As soon as the holder of the certificate ceases to have lawful entitlement to possession of the aircraft.

references.text: CAR Part 47 (47.57 - Change of possession of aircraft)

questions.question: Is the certificate of registration normally carried in the aircraft? What may be an exception?
Which CAR Part deals with aircraft markings?
Aeroplanes with a MCTOW of _____kg or less, and operating within __________ are not required to display the nationality mark.

references.text: CAR Part 47 (47.101(b) - Requirement for aircraft marking.)

questions.question: When an aircraft has been designed, built, tested, and approved, it's issued with a ________________. Which country is this issued in?
questions.answer: Type certificate. The country of origin.

questions.question: Who normally holds possession of a type certificate?
If NZ authorities accept the foreign certification of an aircraft, they can issue a New Zealand ____________________.

references.text: CAR Part 21 (21.41 - Type Acceptance Certificate Requirements)

questions.question: Would a Cessna 172 have a NZ type certificate, or type acceptance certificate? Why?
questions.answer: Type acceptance certificate. The type certificate was issued in the USA.

references.text: CAR Part 21 - (21.41 - Type Acceptance Certificate Requirements)

questions.question: If an airworthiness certificate has been issued, does that mean the aircraft has either a type certificate or type acceptance certificate?
Which certificate is issued when the Director is satisfied the certification requirements for a particular category are met?
An airworthiness certificate specific to (a specific aircraft/a model of aircraft).
Can an airworthiness certificate be transferred to another aircraft?
A person operating an aircraft with an airworthiness certificate has to comply with any ________________ issued with the certificate, and any __________ displayed in the aircraft.
What are the four airworthiness certificate categories?
